sentences: Terius Gray (born March 26, 1975), better known by his stage name Juvenile, is an American rapper best known for his work with Cash Money in the late 1990s and early 2000s, both solo and as a member of the label’s then-flagship group, Hot Boys.
section: N/A

sentences: Juvenile's career began in the early 1990s as a teenager with bounce music recordings that made him a local star.
section: N/A

sentences: He released his debut album Being Myself in 1995.
section: N/A

sentences: After signing to Cash Money, Juvenile released Solja Rags in 1997, which included the major local hit "Solja Rag".
section: N/A

sentences: A year later, he released the multi-platinum 400 Degreez, which included his first nationwide hits "Ha" and "Back That Azz Up".
section: N/A

sentences: He released other successful solo albums for Cash Money: Tha G-Code, Project English and Juve the Great, which included the number-one hit "Slow Motion".
section: N/A

sentences: After leaving Cash Money, Juvenile has released several other albums, including The Beginning of the End with group UTP, which included the anthem "Nolia Clap" and the solo number-one album Reality Check.
section: N/A

== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Juvenile had a daughter, Jelani, with Joy Deleston.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: On February 29, 2008, 4-year-old Jelani was shot and killed in her home, along with mother Deleston and older half sister.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: It was reported that Deleston's oldest child, 17-year-old son Anthony Tyrone Terrell Jr., returned to the home after police arrived and implicated himself in the murder of his mother and siblings.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Terrell was charged with three counts of murder and three counts of aggravated assault.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He remains in the DeKalb County jail.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Though Juvenile received some criticism for not attending the funeral for his daughter and her mother, several statements were released that the rapper was "shocked and devastated" by the event.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: The rapper stated that he made the decision not to appear at the funeral to prevent subsequent media attention, and was concerned that it would divert attention away from the ceremony.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Terrell was given two consecutive life sentences after pleading guilty to killing Joy Deleston, 39, and her daughters, Micaiah, 11, and Jelani.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Due to his age, he could not be sentenced to death in Georgia.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He endorsed Tom Steyer in the 2020 United States presidential election.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: A video of him dancing with Steyer to his hit song "Back That Azz Up" went viral on the internet shortly before the 2020 South Carolina Democratic primary was held.
section: == Personal life ==
== Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: Legal troubles ===
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: In the summer of 2002, Juvenile was arrested for assaulting his barber over charges that the barber was bootlegging his music.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: In January 2003, Juvenile was arrested in New Orleans on drug charges.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: The next month, he was sentenced to 75 hours of community service for a fight outside a nightclub in Miami, Florida in 2001.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: Juvenile was involved in a legal dispute over failure to pay child support for his daughter Jelani with Joy Deleston, a deputy sheriff in Gwinnett County, Georgia.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: A paternity lawsuit was issued by Deleston in 2004, resulting in a DNA test and both parties agreeing that Juvenile was Jelani's father.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: His attorney stated that the case was resolved peacefully by consent order in 2006.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: On February 25, 2010, Juvenile was arrested in Arabi, Louisiana.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: While Juvenile was recording music at a house there, a neighbor called police to report smelling marijuana.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: He was cited on a misdemeanor charge of marijuana possession and later released on bond.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: He pleaded guilty in August 2010 and received a suspended three-month jail sentence and six months of probation and paid a $250 fine and court costs.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===

sentences: In 2013, Juvenile was arrested for failing to pay $170,000 in child support.
section: == Personal life == | === Legal troubles ===
